page.title: 08Public Services.
page.content: TRANSPORT. There are no bus services in the area. The public are allowed on the coach taking children to and from Secondary Schools in Wycombe. Postal vans also run a passenger service to and from Henley. POST. There are two deliveries and collections on week days, one on Sats. Each village has post and phone boxes. DOCTOR. There is no surgery in any of the villages but the Hambleden doctor visits Frieth Village Hall for consultations once a week. PUBLIC LIBRARY. The County Library at Marlow operates a mobile service to the villages. PUBLIC UTILITIES. There is no main drainage or gas supply to the villages, so electricity is used for cooking, and central heating is mainly oil-fired. SECONDARY SCHOOLS. At 12yrs. children go to schools in Wycombe and Marlow.
